com.ericsson.oss.itpf.datalayer.dps.spi

Interface DataBucketManager


  • public interface DataBucketManager
    This interface is used to manage the data buckets from the persistence layer.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      DpsDataBucket createBucket(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String description, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> additionalParameters)
      Create a new data bucket.
      void deleteBucket(java.lang.String name, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> additionalParameters)
      Delete the data bucket from the persistence store.
      java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> getAllDataBucketNames()
      Method to get the names of all data buckets in the system.
      DpsDataBucket getBucket(java.lang.String name, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> additionalParameters)
      Get the stored data bucket with the given name.

    • Method Detail

      • getBucket

        DpsDataBucket getBucket(java.lang.String name,
                        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> additionalParameters)
        Get the stored data bucket with the given name.
        Parameters:
        name - the unique name of the data bucket.
        additionalParameters - map that may be used to pass additional parameters.
        Returns:
        the stored data bucket as retrieved from the persistence store. If no such bucket exists, null will be returned.

      • createBucket

        DpsDataBucket createBucket(java.lang.String name,
                           java.lang.String description,
                           java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> additionalParameters)
        Create a new data bucket.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the new bucket.
        description - a brief description of the new bucket.
        additionalParameters - map that may be used to pass additional parameters.
        Returns:
        the newly created bucket.

      • deleteBucket

        void deleteBucket(java.lang.String name,
                  java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> additionalParameters)
        Delete the data bucket from the persistence store.

        This method will silently ignore buckets which do not exist.

        Also, this method will take no responsibility for handling the objects in the bucket. It is up to the higher levels in DPS to manage those.

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the bucket to be deleted.
        additionalParameters - map that may be used to pass additional parameters.

      • getAllDataBucketNames

        java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> getAllDataBucketNames()
        Method to get the names of all data buckets in the system.
        Returns:
        a collection with the names of all existing buckets in DPS, including the Live bucket.
